dtliExcerpt: Crystal's performance is the show's main draw, and he delivers with the easy authority of a seasoned entertainer who knows how to work a room.
bwwExcerpt: Thirty years ago, Crystal wore aging makeup to play this role on film. He doesn't need it anymore, but he never really did: He has Buddy in his bones. Crystal has been playing this alter kocker alter ego since at least Saturday Night Live in 1985, and Buddy's type of Catskills-and-Friars-Club cut-up...
